Use Bus No. 288D to reach the temple.

context: Taj Falaknuma Palace Embellished with Opulence Often called the mirror of the sky, Taj Falaknuma Palace is a magnificent architecture that stands at the height of a high hill. Located just 5 km away from Charminar, this majestic palace was built by Nawab. Spread across an area of 32 acres, this palace is made of marble. With accommodation of 22 halls and 220 rooms, this place also has an impressive library, magnificent chandeliers, and a staircase made of marble. In 2000, this historic palace was taken over by the Taj Group and converted into a luxury hotel. Falaknuma Palace Dinner will be one of the most luxurious experiences of your life. Location: Engine Bowli, Falaknuma, Hyderabad, Telangana 500053, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for being a historically significant building that is now a five-star hotel. Built By: William Mard Marret. Built In: 3 March 1884. Tip: If traveling by plane, book your airport transfers beforehand. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Taj Falaknuma Palace, located in Engine Bowli, Falaknuma, Hyderabad, is a luxurious hotel set in a 32-acre marble palace built in 1884 by William Mard Marret. Situated 5 km from Charminar, it features 22 halls, 220 rooms, an impressive library, and magnificent chandeliers. Open 24 hours, it offers a lavish experience with pre-booked airport transfers recommended.

context: Gandipet Lake Experience Tranquillity Gandipet Lake is the main reservoir of the twin cities Hyderabad and Secunderabad. The lake is spread across a region of 46 km²; this was built by the Hyderabadi Nizam Mir Osman Ali Khan to protect the land from the floods. Made in the year 1920, standing at this reservoir one can enjoy a scenic sunset. Location: Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, India. Famous For: It is famous for bird watching and witnessing beautiful landscapes. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1920. Tip: It is a popular picnic spot. Make sure you spend enough time soaking in the beauty of this lake. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Gandipet Lake, located in the Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, is the main reservoir for Hyderabad and Secunderabad. Built in 1920 by Mir Osman Ali Khan to prevent flooding, it covers 46 km². Famous for bird watching and beautiful landscapes, it's a popular picnic spot perfect for enjoying scenic sunsets.

context: Mount Opera Loaded with Fun Mount Opera is an exciting and entertaining water park located in the main city of Hyderabad. Just 4 km away from the Ramoji Film City, this place is a great escape for a family day out. Located at a hilltop, this water park offers exciting activities like boating, rain dance, and discotheque, which makes the night more thrilling. Location: Batasingaram, Highway Ranga Reddy District, Hyderabad, Telangana 501528, India. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being the only waterpark situated atop a hill. Built By: Shivam Amusements Pvt. Ltd. Built In: 1991. Tip: Wear comfortable clothes for dry rides. Avoid dresses and skirts. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Mount Opera, located in Batasingaram, Highway Ranga Reddy District, Hyderabad, is a hilltop water park built in 1991 by Shivam Amusements Pvt. Ltd. Just 4 km from Ramoji Film City, it offers boating, rain dance, and a discotheque. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, wear comfortable clothes for dry rides, avoiding dresses and skirts.

context: Paigah Tombs Stunning Architecture The Paigah tombs reflect the beautiful blend of Asaf Jah and Rajputi style in its architecture. Located just 10 km away from Charminar, these tombs are a perfect example of the architecture. Built of marble and with mesmerizing interiors, the tombs also showcase the beautiful Jaali work at the windows. Location: Qalandar Nagar Rd, Santosh Nagar, Kanchan Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 500058, India. Timings: 10 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its architecture and the interiors made of mosaic tiles. Built By: Nawab Taig Jung Bahadur. Built In: 1787. Tip: Do not litter when strolling around the tomb. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Paigah Tombs, located on Qalandar Nagar Rd, Santosh Nagar, Kanchan Bagh, Hyderabad, is a blend of Asaf Jah and Rajputi architectural styles. Built in 1787 by Nawab Taig Jung Bahadur, these marble tombs feature intricate Jaali work and mosaic tile interiors. Open from 10 AM to 6 PM, visitors should avoid littering.

context: Taramati Baradari Majestic Interiors Taramati Baradari is located outside the Golconda Fort on the Gandipet Road. This is one of the most popular historic places in Hyderabad and comprises a music hall with 12 entrances. The legendary artist Taramathi used to perform here. It is said that Taramati and Premamati were the most popular artists during the reign of Abdullah Qutub Shah. Location: Ramdev Guda, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 500031, India. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for exhibiting the Persian-style architecture. Built By: Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. Built In: 1880s. Tip: You can cover this spot when you visit the Golconda Fort. You do not have to plan another trip to the Baradari. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Taramati Baradari, located on Gandipet Road, Ramdev Guda, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, is a historic music hall with 12 entrances built in the 1880s by Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. Famous for Persian-style architecture, it was a performance venue for artists Taramathi and Premamati. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, it can be visited along with Golconda Fort.

context: Tank Bund A Refreshing Evening Escape Tank Bund connects Hyderabad to Secunderabad and is a popular hangout spot located in the city. The place showcases mesmerizing views of the majestic Hussain Sagar Lake with a monolith of Buddha in the centre. The entire area of Tank Bund comprises 33 bronze statues of popular figures including Nannaya, Tikkana, Erra Pragada, Shri Krishna Devaraya, and many more. Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for connecting the two parts of the city, Hyderabad and Secunderabad. Built By: Hazrat Hussain Shah Wali. Built In: 1563. Tip: Drive around the dam during the sunset to witness its beauty at its best. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Tank Bund, connecting Hyderabad and Secunderabad, is a popular hangout spot offering mesmerizing views of Hussain Sagar Lake and a Buddha monolith. Built by Hazrat Hussain Shah Wali in 1563, it features 33 bronze statues of notable figures. Open 24 hours, it's best enjoyed during sunset.

context: Necklace Road Prepossessing Views Inspired by the Queen’s Necklace of Mumbai, this amazing Necklace Road stretches for over 3 km connecting NTR Gardens, Lumbini Park, and Sanjeevaiah Park. The shape of this road is like a necklace and the surrounding Hussain Sagar Lake beautifies this road. Don’t forget to drive thru this stunning road while staying in Hyderabad for a perfect vacation. Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for connecting popular attractions in the shape of a necklace. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: There is a pitstop along the road where you can try Go Karting. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Necklace Road in Hyderabad, inspired by Mumbai's Queen's Necklace, stretches over 3 km connecting NTR Gardens, Lumbini Park, and Sanjeevaiah Park. Shaped like a necklace and beautified by Hussain Sagar Lake, it is a must-drive location open 24 hours. Try Go Karting at a pitstop along the road.

context: Sanghi Temple Seek Blessings Sanghi Temple is a beautiful temple nearly 25 km away from Hyderabad and is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara. Located on the Paramanand Giri, this temple exhibits the architectural style of the Chola-Chalukya dynasty. The temple complex also comprises temples of other Hindu deities including Parvathy, Ganesha, Rama, etc. The garden next to the temple is known for the vibrant collection of floras. Location: Omerkhan daira, Hyderabad, Telangana 501511, India. Timings: 6 AM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its architectural beauty and vibrant gardens. Built By: Sanghi Group. Built In: 1991. Tip: Make sure you are dressed modestly for the temple. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Sanghi Temple, located in Omerkhan Daira, Hyderabad, is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara and showcases Chola-Chalukya architectural style. Built by the Sanghi Group in 1991, it features temples of other Hindu deities and vibrant gardens. Open from 6 AM to 8 PM, visitors should dress modestly.

context: KBR National Park For Nature Lovers KBR National Park is one of the largest national parks in Telangana and exhibits a vibrant collection of flora and fauna. From lush green environments to the energetic chirping of birds, this astounding National Park is truly a delight for nature enthusiasts. Location: Road Number 2, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 5:30 AM to 10 AM, 4:30 PM to 7 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its lush green diversity of flora and exotic fauna. Built By: Prince Azam Jah. Built In: 1967. Tip: Do not play around with the wildlife in this National Park. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: KBR National Park, located on Road Number 2, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, is one of Telangana's largest national parks, featuring diverse flora and fauna. Built by Prince Azam Jah in 1967, it offers lush green environments and bird watching. Open from 5:30 AM to 10 AM and 4:30 PM to 7 PM, visitors should respect wildlife.

context: Wonderla Amusement Park An Exhilarating Experience One of the best places to visit in Hyderabad is Wonderla Amusement Park, where you can enjoy multiple fun rides. One can easily spend an entire day at Wonderla with friends and family. The atmosphere is cheerful and happening, and people are high on fun. If you do not have a fear of heights, then you should definitely come to this place on your trip to Hyderabad. Location: Nehru Outer Ring Rd, Exit No. 13, Ravirala, Hyderabad, Telangana 501510. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for offering the best amusement park experience to kids and adults. Built By: Wonderla Holidays. Built In: 2016. Tip: Get a fast track ticket to skip the long queues. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Wonderla Amusement Park, located on Nehru Outer Ring Rd, Exit No. 13, Ravirala, Hyderabad, offers a thrilling experience with multiple fun rides. Built by Wonderla Holidays in 2016, it's perfect for a full day with friends and family. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, fast track tickets are recommended to avoid queues.

context: Sudha’s Car Museum Intriguing Handmade Cars Sudha’s Car Museum is not an unusual place to visit if you like cars and automobiles. It is one of the most amazing places to see in Hyderabad where you will find a number of handmade cars on display. You will also find information like the year of manufacture and cost of every exhibit. The museum was started by Kanyaboyina Sudhakar who had an interest in cars since childhood. The museum was opened in 2010 and has been attracting car enthusiasts ever since. Location: Bahadurpura X Road, APHB Colony, Bahadurpura, West Hyderabad, Telangana 500064. Timings: 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its impeccable collection of vintage cars. Built By: K. Sudhakar. Built In: 2010. Tip: All car enthusiasts should definitely pay a visit to this museum. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Sudha’s Car Museum, located at Bahadurpura X Road, APHB Colony, Bahadurpura, West Hyderabad, Telangana, features a collection of handmade and vintage cars. Opened in 2010 by K. Sudhakar, it provides detailed information about each exhibit. Open from 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM, it's a must-visit for car enthusiasts.

context: Sri Jagannath Temple Fascinating Infrastructure One of the most beautiful tourist spots in Hyderabad is Sri Jagannath Temple. It is a modern temple located in Banjara Hills. The temple is built by the Odia community and has been dedicated to Lord Jagannath, the God of the Universe. You will be mesmerized by the shikhara style pattern of the temple. There are also Shrines dedicated to Lakshmi, Shiva, Ganesha, Hanuman, and Navagraha. Location: Plot 1269, Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 6 AM to 12 PM, 5 PM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its annual Rathyatra festival. Built By: Kalinga Cultural Trust. Built In: 2009. Tip: Make sure you visit around the annual Rathyatra festival. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Sri Jagannath Temple, located at Plot 1269, Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a modern temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath and built by the Odia community in 2009. Open from 6 AM to 12 PM and 5 PM to 9 PM, it features shikhara style architecture and shrines to other deities. Visit during the annual Rathyatra festival.

context: Nizam’s Museum Depicting Luxury If you are visiting Charminar, then you should make a stop by Nizam’s Museum that is located in the heart of Purani Haveli. Get an insight into the royal life of the Nizam of Hyderabad and how lavishly he lived. You will find artifacts and articles from his life on display. From the fancy clothes to utensils, Nizam sure knew how to live a life of luxury and opulence. It is one of the most famous places in Hyderabad to visit on your trip. Location: Purani Haveli, Pathar Gatti, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its collection of items that once served as gifts to the last Nizam of Hyderabad. Built By: Nawab Mir Mahboob Ali Khan. Built In: 1936. Tip: Capture some of the beautiful souvenirs in your camera. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Nizam’s Museum, located in Purani Haveli, Pathar Gatti, Hyderabad, showcases the luxurious life of the last Nizam of Hyderabad. Built in 1936 by Nawab Mir Mahboob Ali Khan, it displays artifacts and articles from his life. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM, visitors should capture the beautiful souvenirs.

context: ISKCON Temple Sparkling with Spirituality ISKCON Temples are known for being beautiful and spiritual all over the world. If ISKCON is your home for spirituality, then you will find one in the Nampally region in Hyderabad. The beautiful idols of Sri Sri Jagannatha and Sri Radha are so beautiful to look at. Don’t forget to attend the Aarti because it is one of the most beautiful experiences. It is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad in the evening. Location: Nampally Station Road, Sri Sri Radha Madanmohan Mandir, Hare Krishna Land, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana 500001. Timings: 4:30 AM to 1 PM, 4 PM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for the temple’s devotion to Lord Krishna. Built By: Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada. Built In: NA. Tip: This temple does not allow food inside, especially if it has onion and garlic. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: ISKCON Temple, located on Nampally Station Road, Sri Sri Radha Madanmohan Mandir, Hare Krishna Land, Abids, Hyderabad, is a spiritual center dedicated to Lord Krishna. With beautiful idols of Sri Jagannatha and Sri Radha, it offers a memorable Aarti experience. Open from 4:30 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 9 PM, food with onion and garlic is not allowed.

context: Madina Market Every Shopaholic’s Dream Madina Market is a textile market in Hyderabad, and if you are looking to shop for clothes, then this is where you should head on your trip to the city. It is a great place to buy items at wholesale prices. Location: Patel Market, Rikab Gunj, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 10 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: It is famous for traditional Hyderabadi outfits. Built By: NA. Built In: 1938. Tip: Carry a bag to keep the things you splurge on. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Madina Market, located in Patel Market, Rikab Gunj, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, is a textile market known for traditional Hyderabadi outfits. Established in 1938, it's a great place for buying clothes at wholesale prices. Open from 10 AM to 11 PM, visitors should carry a bag for their purchases.

context: Paigah Palace Marvellous Architecture The Paigah family came next in hierarchy to the ruling family of Nizams. The Paigahs were also the first palace builders of Hyderabad. Paigah Palace was built by a Paigah nobleman Sir Vicar-ul-Umra after he gave the beautiful Falaknuma Palace to the sixth Nizam of Hyderabad. This beautiful palace was built in the early 1900s. Its architecture has led the place to land among the top places to visit in Hyderabad. Location: Begumpet, Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its charm that it exudes from every nook. Built By: Sir Vicar-ul-Umra. Built In: Early 1900s. Tip: You can plan a great Royal wedding affair at this destination. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Paigah Palace, located in Begumpet, Hyderabad, was built in the early 1900s by Sir Vicar-ul-Umra after gifting Falaknuma Palace to the sixth Nizam. Known for its charming architecture, it is one of the top places to visit in Hyderabad. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM, it is a great venue for a Royal wedding.

context: GVK One Mall Fun One of the best places to visit in Hyderabad for shopping is GVK One Mall. Spread over an area of 3.5 lakh square feet, this is a spectacular mall located in the posh area of Banjara Hills. So if you are planning to shop while in Hyderabad, check out this stunning mall. Location: Rd Number 1, Balapur Basthi, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 10:30 AM to 10 PM. Famous For: It is famous for high-end brands like Charles & Keith, Calvin Klein, and more. Built By: GVK Group. Built In: 1 May 2009. Tip: You can have a great time if you go with your friends and family. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: GVK One Mall, located on Rd Number 1, Balapur Basthi, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a premier shopping destination. Spread over 3.5 lakh square feet and built by GVK Group in 2009, it features high-end brands like Charles & Keith and Calvin Klein. Open from 10:30 AM to 10 PM, it is perfect for shopping with friends and family.

context: Osman Sagar Lake Views One of the best tourist places in Hyderabad is Osman Sagar Lake. The lake not only offers picturesque views and experiences but is also surrounded by famous entertainment sources like Treasure Island and Ocean Park, which make it a destination worth visiting. Location: Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, India. Famous For: It is famous for protecting the city from floods. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1920. Tip: Try going to the lake early in the morning to enjoy the surreal views. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Osman Sagar Lake, located in Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, is renowned for its picturesque views and entertainment options like Treasure Island and Ocean Park. Built by Mir Osman Ali Khan in 1920, it also protects the city from floods. Visit early in the morning for the best experience.

context: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam Views This is one of the world’s largest dams, whose sight will leave you jaw-dropped. The dam has as many as 26 gates and is 124 meters tall. It is surrounded by lush greenery, which makes it one of the best tourist places in Hyderabad. People visit the dam to marvel at its magnificence and magnanimous structure. Location: Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh, and Nalgonda district, Telangana. Timings: 9 AM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for playing a crucial role in irrigation in Andhra Pradesh. Built By: Raja Of Muktyala. Built In: 1955. Tip: You can take a bus to Nagarjuna bus stand to reach this destination. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam, located in Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh, and Nalgonda district, Telangana, is one of the world's largest dams with 26 gates and a height of 124 meters. Built by the Raja Of Muktyala in 1955, it plays a crucial role in irrigation. Open from 9 AM to 9 PM, take a bus to Nagarjuna bus stand for access.

context: Inorbit Mall For Shopping Fun If you are done with sightseeing in Hyderabad, then head to this mall. Inorbit Mall is one of the biggest malls in Hyderabad, home to numerous brands, eateries, and recreational activities. It is listed among places to visit in Hyderabad, so make sure you visit it during your trip. Location: Hitech City, Hyderabad. Timings: 11 AM to 9:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being home to global brands, international café chains, and gaming zones. Built By: K. Raheja Corporation and Evo Enterprises. Built In: 2004. Tip: This is a perfect spot for women to enjoy shopping from global brands. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Inorbit Mall, located in Hitech City, Hyderabad, is one of the city's largest malls featuring global brands, international café chains, and gaming zones. Built by K. Raheja Corporation and Evo Enterprises in 2004, it is open from 11 AM to 9:30 PM and is ideal for shopping enthusiasts.

context: Peddamma Temple Stunning Architecture Peddamma Temple is one of the most beautiful places to see in Hyderabad where you can make your wishes and seek prayers. The temple offers architectural beauty and a peaceful atmosphere. If you are looking for peace and tranquility, then this is among the best places to visit in Hyderabad. Location: Jagadish Nagar, Begumpet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500003. Timings: Open 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for its architectural beauty and stunning interiors. Built By: P. Janardhan Reddy. Built In: 1993. Tip: Try visiting the temple during the celebrations of Bonalu. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Peddamma Temple, located in Jagadish Nagar, Begumpet, Hyderabad, is known for its stunning architecture and peaceful atmosphere. Built by P. Janardhan Reddy in 1993, it is open 24 hours. Visit during the Bonalu celebrations for a special experience.

context: Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple An Ancient Temple Another religious place to visit in Hyderabad is Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple, located in the serene village of Ammapali. The temple is believed to be 800 years old and has played a significant role in the history of the area. The monument of the temple is believed to be older than the Golconda Fort and exhibits Rajasthani-style architecture that comprises a step well and gopuram. This is among the best Hyderabad tourist places. Location: Nagarguda, Shamshabad Rd, Near Rajeev Gandhi International Airport, Telangana 501218. Timings: 6 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is a popular spot for film shoots of Tollywood movies. Built By: Vengi kings. Built In: 13th century. Tip: Do not forget to carry your cameras. TripAdvisor Reviews.
summary: Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple, located in Nagarguda, Shamshabad Rd, near Rajeev Gandhi International Airport, Telangana, is an 800-year-old temple with Rajasthani-style architecture. Built by the Vengi kings in the 13th century, it is a popular spot for Tollywood film shoots. Open from 6 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 8 PM, bring your cameras.

context: Charminar Bazaar Explore the Charm One of the finest Hyderabad tourist spots, we welcome you to one of the most affordable markets that sits every Sunday where you can shop loads even with a restricted budget. The bazaar carries a distinctive character that clearly demarcates the Nizami influence of the city. Be it the items that are sold or the street food, you will feel the charm of an old city much like the markets of Chandni Chowk in Delhi. Get the fresh aroma of kebabs, Irani chai, the glittery glass bangles, and everything that excites a budget shopaholic. The certain culture makes it one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad with friends. Location: Laad Bazaar Road, Mitti Ka Sher, Charminar, Lad Bazar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 11 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: Really affordable handicrafts. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Do not forget to try the Irani chai with Osmania biscuits.
summary: Charminar Bazaar, located on Laad Bazaar Road, Mitti Ka Sher, Charminar, Lad Bazar, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a vibrant market open from 11 AM to 11 PM. Known for affordable handicrafts, kebabs, Irani chai, and glass bangles, it reflects the Nizami influence. It's a budget-friendly shopping destination, perfect for friends.

context: Begum Bazaar Relish the Vibrant Aura Begum Bazaar is the biggest commercial market in Hyderabad located close to the old city. The market is mostly flocked by locals citing retail and wholesale items for home. Yes, it’s true that it might not top the list of top Hyderabad tourist spots, yet there is some charm in it. The market also has one of the second largest fish markets in Hyderabad. Location: Afzal Gunj, Hyderabad, Telangana 500012. Timings: 10 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: The fish market selling a variety of fish hatched from the nearby regions. Built By: Humda Begum. Built In: 1812. Tip: Keep loads of cash as online payment isn’t the trend here.
summary: Begum Bazaar, located in Afzal Gunj, Hyderabad, Telangana, is the city's largest commercial market, open from 10 AM to 11 PM. Built by Humda Begum in 1812, it features one of Hyderabad's largest fish markets. It is popular for retail and wholesale shopping. Carry cash, as online payments are uncommon.

context: Ocean Park For a Good Time Welcome to the sprawling waterpark quite popular as one of the top Hyderabad tourist spots for its recreational capability. Expect a full day of entertainment and fun while the cool water in summers gushes past you. The park is segmented into 2 sections: an entire area is dedicated to water sports, while another area is solely reserved for amusement games. Hands down, this is one of the best Hyderabad sightseeing options if you are traveling with family and also one of the most sought after places to visit in summer in Hyderabad. Location: H. No. Survey No. 166, 167, 168, 169, Shankarpalli Rd, near CBIT College, Gandipet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500075. Timings: 11 AM to 7:30 PM. Famous For: Amusement rides, restaurants serving food at affordable prices. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Outside garments are not allowed. You have to wear swimming costumes provided by authorities.
summary: Ocean Park, located at Survey No. 166, 167, 168, 169, Shankarpalli Rd, near CBIT College, Gandipet, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a popular waterpark offering water sports and amusement games. Open from 11 AM to 7:30 PM, it features amusement rides and affordable restaurants. Visitors must wear provided swimming costumes.

context: Botanical Garden Nature’s Splendour Every major city in India has a botanical garden, and Hyderabad cannot be far behind. After all, there are many reasons to love Hyderabad, be it the tourist attractions, culture, street food, or affordable shopping destinations. The Hyderabad Botanical Gardens is one such open area you will definitely desire to visit, citing the rejuvenation appeal. The land of the garden is protected by the Kothaguda Reserve Forest area. Spread across a massive 120 acres, this is the place to be in Hyderabad after a tiring day at the office or if you like to relax within the greenery. Location: Kothaguda Reserve Forest, Gachibowli Road, Near HiTech City, Kondapur, Hyderabad, Telangana 500032. Timings: 9 AM to 7:30 PM. Famous For: The varied species of flora on display and relaxing in the bliss. Built By: Telangana Forest Department. Built In: 2018. Tip: Do not pluck any flowers as they are nature’s property.
summary: Botanical Garden, located in Kothaguda Reserve Forest, Gachibowli Road, Near HiTech City, Kondapur, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a rejuvenating 120-acre area with varied flora species. Established by the Telangana Forest Department in 2018, it's open from 9 AM to 7:30 PM. Visitors should avoid plucking flowers.

context: Moazzam Jahi Market Reflecting Hyderabad’s Culture Another place in the city which clearly indicates the style and grandeur of the Nizams is the Moazzam Jahi Market. The market, mostly known for selling fruits in the beginning, now has almost everything you can expect from a market, including vegetables, groceries, flowers, earthen pots, dry fruits, and ittar. The market was once a place that might have helped make it to the top Hyderabad sightseeing destinations, but since the 1980s, it has been dismantled, and several specialties have been shifted to other markets. Still, it stands tall and is one of the ideal places to visit in Hyderabad with friends. Location: JN Road, Chandra Vihar, Old Kattal Mandi, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana 500001. Timings: 9 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: The culture that it has preserved throughout the years. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1935. Tip: Carry cash if you want to buy something.
summary: Moazzam Jahi Market, located on JN Road, Chandra Vihar, Old Kattal Mandi, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana, is known for its diverse offerings, from fruits to dry fruits and ittar. Built by Mir Osman Ali Khan in 1935, it reflects the grandeur of the Nizams. Open from 9 AM to 11 PM, carry cash for purchases.

context: Nalgonda An Ancient City Sumukh Teja Vanamala for Wikimedia Commons An ideal place for history buffs, Nalgonda is an ancient city located near Hyderabad. With pristine waterfall cascades and ancient forts, this city is one of the best places in Hyderabad for an enriching historic tour and memorable experience. It is to be noted that Nalgonda is as ancient as the Palaeolithic Age and is home to an array of popular tourist attractions. Undeniably, it is one of the best tourist places near Hyderabad. Location: 90 kms from Hyderabad. Famous For: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: A perfect place to visit with family and friends. Enjoy backpacking, trekking, and sightseeing in the city.
summary: Nalgonda, located 90 km from Hyderabad, is an ancient city ideal for history buffs. Known for pristine waterfalls and ancient forts, it dates back to the Palaeolithic Age. Popular tourist attractions include Nagarjuna Sagar Dam. It's perfect for family and friends to enjoy backpacking, trekking, and sightseeing.

context: Mahabubnagar Haven for History Buffs Naidugari Jayanna for Wikimedia Commons A popular historical destination near Hyderabad, Mahabubnagar is known as the land of the Chola Dynasty. One of the most ancient places in South India, the city is a haven for history lovers. With a plethora of historic sites and tourist attractions such as Jama Masjid, Medina Masjid, and Mecca Masjid, this city is a place near Hyderabad. Location: 98 km away from Hyderabad. Famous For: Jama Masjid, Mecca Masjid, and Medina Masjid. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Visit this place from October to March to avoid the summer heat.
summary: Mahabubnagar, located 98 km from Hyderabad, is an ancient city known for its historical significance. It is famous for sites like Jama Masjid, Medina Masjid, and Mecca Masjid. Ideal for history lovers, it is best visited from October to March to avoid the summer heat.

context: Jewel Of Nizam The Minar Dine Around Opulence Dipped in royalty, this luxurious dining place is for the ones who wish to indulge in a lavish dining experience and treat their taste palettes. It’s a perfect haven for couples as well as families wanting to be pampered by rich cuisines along with an opulent ambiance. The marvelous entries will definitely make one fall for this wonderful place. Location: The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, Sagarmahal Complex, Hyderabad. Foods: Lamb Biryani, Apricot Pudding, Veg Shorba, Tomato Shorba. Timings: 12:30 PM to 3 PM, 7 PM to 11 PM. Tip: Don’t forget to gorge on Hyderabadi and Mughlai cuisine here. Cost For Two: INR 2500 approximately.
summary: Jewel Of Nizam, located at The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, Sagarmahal Complex, Hyderabad, offers a luxurious dining experience with rich cuisines in an opulent ambiance. Open from 12:30 PM to 3 PM and 7 PM to 11 PM, it's perfect for couples and families. Must-try dishes include Lamb Biryani and Apricot Pudding.

context: Paradise Biryani Biryani Lovers’ Sweet Retreat All the Biryani lovers, this is the place to be. Offering the most delicious biryani in Hyderabad is this Paradise Biryani, which speaks volumes of its traditional values. Apart from offering Hyderabadi biryani, it services various other cuisines as well that are definitely worth a try. The chefs here make sure to lend each dish an authentic taste. Frequently visited by both locals as well as tourists, this eatery should be visited by all gastronomes. Location: Paradise Circle, Hyderabad. Foods: Mutton Biryani, Mirchi Salan, Chicken Hara Bhara Kebab, Chicken Dum Biryani. Timings: 11 AM to 11 PM. Tip: Don’t forget to try various kinds of biryani here. Cost For Two: INR 800.
summary: Paradise Biryani, located at Paradise Circle, Hyderabad, is famous for its traditional Hyderabadi biryani and other authentic cuisines. Open from 11 AM to 11 PM, it is frequented by locals and tourists. Must-try dishes include Mutton Biryani and Chicken Dum Biryani. Cost for two is approximately INR 800.

context: Kismet A Party Animals’ Den One of the best tourist places in Hyderabad, Kismet is the ultimate stop for all party lovers. With a lively ambiance accompanied by some toothsome meals and drinks to die for, this place will let you enter into a different world altogether. Especially if you wish to enjoy the nightlife of Hyderabad, this place very well deserves your visit. Be it the music, staff, lights, atmosphere, foods, or drinks, everything here is up to the mark, and that is why it is one of the best places in Hyderabad. Location: The Park Hotel, 22, 1st Floor, Raj Bhavan Road, Somajiguda. Foods: Cocktails, Snacks, Pepper Prawns, Drinks, Starters. Timings: 8 PM till midnight. Tip: If you want to witness the vivid nightlife of Hyderabad, visit here. Cost For Two: INR 3000 approximately.
summary: Kismet, located at The Park Hotel, 1st Floor, Raj Bhavan Road, Somajiguda, Hyderabad, is a top destination for party lovers. With lively ambiance, great music, and delicious food and drinks, it is perfect for experiencing Hyderabad's nightlife. Open from 8 PM till midnight, cost for two is approximately INR 3000.

context: Coco’s Bar And Grill For Soothing All Senses Boasting a cozy and quaint ambiance, this place is ideal for casual dining with friends and family. From Italian to North Indian and from Continental to Chinese, you will find all the common cuisines here loved by the visitors. With a separate bar space as well as smoke space, it makes a great spot for individuals to hang out and chill. Moreover, the live music over the rooftop area enhances its overall charm. Location: Plot 217, Opposite KBR Park, Beside TDP Office, Road 2, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad. Foods: Thai Roast Chicken, Chilli Cheese Toast, Ravioli, Chicken Lasagna. Timings: 7 PM till midnight. Tip: If you wish to take your partner here, visit in the evening during live performances. Cost For Two: INR 1700.
summary: Coco’s Bar And Grill, located at Plot 217, Opposite KBR Park, Beside TDP Office, Road 2, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, offers a cozy ambiance for casual dining with friends and family. With a variety of cuisines and live rooftop music, it is open from 7 PM till midnight. Cost for two is approximately INR 1700.

context: Amnesia Lounge Bar And Club For Ultimate Culinary Experience Yet another place for live entertainment and oodles of relaxation, Amnesia Lounge Bar and Club is one of the most visited places in Hyderabad. You can treat your taste buds with varied cuisines including Chinese, American, Continental, Italian, and North Indian. While bragging about amazing night music, zealous DJ, and refreshing cocktails and mocktails, this place leaves no stone unturned to give its visitors an ultimate refreshing time. Location: Plot 1102, 5th Floor, Jaya Chambers, Road 36, Jubilee Hills. Foods: Tandoori Veg Platter, Whiskey Cocktail, Corn Kernels, Chicken Popcorn, Chilli Mushroom. Timings: 7 PM till midnight. Tip: Don’t forget to enjoy the night entertainment here. Cost For Two: INR 1300.
summary: Amnesia Lounge Bar And Club, located at Plot 1102, 5th Floor, Jaya Chambers, Road 36, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, is known for live entertainment and varied cuisines. With amazing night music, DJ, cocktails, and mocktails, it is perfect for relaxation. Open from 7 PM till midnight, cost for two is approximately INR 1300.

context: Mysore Palace Among the most popular places to visit in Mysore, Mysore Palace was once the residence of Wodeyar dynasty rulers who ruled Mysore for seven centuries. The palace is considered one of the largest in India, with more than 2.7 million visitors every year. The brilliant architecture and intricate craftsmanship with which it is built make it an incredible masterpiece. The doorways and corridors make you travel through time to stories of the past. Visiting the palace is one of the most appealing things to do in Mysore, especially for all the history buffs out there. The palace consists of pavilions, large halls, and various shrines. During the most celebrated Dasara festival, the palace is richly decorated to display the culture and heritage of those times. In the evening time, when illuminated by 98,000 light bulbs, it is a spectacular sight worth capturing in your mind forever. Location: Sayyaji Rao Rd, Agrahara, Chamrajpura, Mysuru. How To Reach: The nearest railway station is Mysore Junction, which is 2 km. Famous For: Architecture. Timings: Every day from 10 am to 5:30 pm. Entry Fee: INR 40 per person for adults and INR 20 per person for children. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Mysore Palace, located on Sayyaji Rao Rd, Agrahara, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, is a grand architectural marvel and historical residence of the Wodeyar dynasty. Open daily from 10 am to 5:30 pm, it is renowned for its intricate craftsmanship. The palace is especially stunning during the Dasara festival and when illuminated by 98,000 bulbs in the evening. Entry fee is INR 40 for adults and INR 20 for children.

context: Lalitha Mahal The palace of Mysore, Lalitha Mahal, was initially built to serve as a guest house to the royal family's guests. It is located at the foot of Chamundi Hills and also offers scintillating views of the hills around and is one of the beautiful places to visit in Mysore. The exquisite interiors of the palace adorned with Belgian crystal chandeliers and Persian carpets are spectacular. A part of the palace has now been converted to a heritage hotel and is being managed by India Tourism Development Corporation (ITDC). Do visit this palace to feel the royal ambiance. Location: Lalitha Mahal Palace Road, Lalithmahal Nagar Layout, Mysuru. How To Reach: The best way to reach the Palace is through flight; the nearest airport is 15 km away. Famous For: Second largest Palace in Mysore. Timings: Every day from 10 am to 5:30 pm. Entry Fee: INR 100 per person. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 3. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Lalitha Mahal, located on Lalitha Mahal Palace Road, Mysuru, was built as a guest house for the royal family. It features exquisite interiors with Belgian crystal chandeliers and Persian carpets. Now a heritage hotel managed by ITDC, it is open daily from 10 am to 5:30 pm. Entry fee is INR 100 per person.

context: Jagmohan Palace One of the famous Mysore tourist places, Jaganmohan Palace was initially constructed to be used as a residence for the royal family, but it was later converted to an art gallery. The gallery houses many valuable artifacts and artworks from South India. The famous works of Indian artists such as Raja Ravi Verma's oil paintings and S.G. Heldnkr's Lady with the Lamp are also kept here. The antiques and some intricate masterpieces also feature at the art gallery. Location: Deshika Rd, opp City Bus Stand, Devaraja Mohalla, Chamrajpura, Mysuru. How To Reach: The nearest airport is 11 km from this palace; you can take a cab from there to this Palace. Famous For: Exclusive art collection. Timings: Every day from 10 am to 5:30 pm. Entry Fee: INR 20 per person for adults and INR 10 per person for children. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Jaganmohan Palace, located on Deshika Rd, opposite City Bus Stand, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, is an art gallery with valuable artifacts and artworks from South India. Open daily from 10 am to 5:30 pm, it features famous works such as Raja Ravi Verma's oil paintings. Entry fee is INR 20 for adults and INR 10 for children.

context: Karanji Lake Capturing over 90 acres, the largest lake in Karnataka is among the most gorgeous tourist places in Mysore. Karanji Lake is situated at the base of Chamundi hills and qualifies as the best option for enjoying nature's scenic views. Adding to it, the highlight of the lake is India's largest aviary that houses more than 70 species of birds. Serving as a home to migratory birds, it is a picturesque spot for all the bird lovers and nature admirers and one of the tourist spots in Mysore. How To Reach: The palace lies hardly 5 km away from the railway station. Famous For: Houses the largest aviary in India. Timings: 8:30 am to 5:30 pm (closed on Tuesday). Entry Fee: INR 10 per person for adults and INR 5 per person for children. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Karanji Lake, located at the base of Chamundi hills in Mysore, spans over 90 acres and features India's largest aviary with over 70 bird species. Open from 8:30 am to 5:30 pm (closed on Tuesdays), it is ideal for bird lovers. Entry fee is INR 10 for adults and INR 5 for children.

context: Melody World Wax Museum The art museum in India, Melody World, is one of its kind. As the name suggests, the museum showcases a collection of over a hundred wax statues and over three hundred musical instruments. The instruments and bands are displayed here range from the stone age to the modern date showcasing different genres such as Jazz, Pop, Chinese, Tribal, Rock, Punjabi Bhangra, Hip Hop, etc. It is a tribute to famous music artists from all over the world. Also, it is one of the most famous Mysore sightseeing places, top tourist places in Mysore. Location: 1, Vihara Marga, Kurubara Halli, Siddhartha Layout, Mysuru. How To Reach: Hardly 10 km away from the nearest railway station; you can take a cab from the railway station. Famous For: Statues playing musical instruments from all over the world. Timings: Every day from 9:30 am to 7:00 pm. Entry Fee: INR 30 per person. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 3. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Melody World Wax Museum, located at 1, Vihara Marga, Kurubara Halli, Siddhartha Layout, Mysuru, features over a hundred wax statues and three hundred musical instruments. Open daily from 9:30 am to 7:00 pm, it showcases genres from Jazz to Hip Hop. Entry fee is INR 30 per person.

context: Railway Museum The railway museum in Mysore is the second largest after the one in Delhi, and it is certainly one of the best places to see in Mysore. The museum also puts on display the initial locomotives and steam engines. A mini-train takes the visitors on a ride through the premises of the museum. A section also displays the luxurious travels undertaken by royal dynasties of Mysore, which consists of dining rooms, kitchen, and royal toilet. Kids love the place owing to the storehouse of interesting stuff around. Among all the best Mysore tourist places, this is the best attraction to visit with kids. If you are making a Mysore trip plan, don't forget to include this destination. Location: KRS Rd, Opp CFTRI, Medar Block, Yadavagiri, Mysuru. How To Reach: 2 km from the metro, so can either take a cab or a battery rickshaw. Famous For: Owns the largest collection of trains. Timings: 9:30 am to 5:30 pm (closed on Monday). Entry Fee: INR 15 per person for adults and INR 10 per person for children. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Railway Museum, located on KRS Rd, Opp CFTRI, Medar Block, Yadavagiri, Mysuru, is the second largest in India, featuring initial locomotives and steam engines. Open from 9:30 am to 5:30 pm (closed on Mondays), it offers a mini-train ride and showcases royal travel luxuries. Entry fee is INR 15 for adults and INR 10 for children.

context: St. Philomena Church Clearly, Mysore is all about grand architectures. Next on the list of best places to see in Mysore is St. Philomena Church, which is one of the largest Cathedrals in South Asia. Gothic style, the construction plan of the church has been laid very thoughtfully. The church's basement has catacombs below the main altar. The floor plan is laid in the shape of the Holy Cross with Congregation Hall, Choir, and Transepts over its ends. The stained glass windows depict the paintings of famous events of Christ's era. This is one of the most famous churches in Mysore you must plan your visit to. Location: Lourdes Nagar, Ashoka Rd, Lashkar Mohalla, Mysuru. How To Reach: Is 3 km away from the local bus stand and 2 km away from the Mysore Palace. Famous For: Height of 175m is the second tallest church in Asia. Timings: Every day from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: St. Philomena Church, located in Lourdes Nagar, Ashoka Rd, Lashkar Mohalla, Mysuru, is a grand Gothic-style cathedral and one of the largest in South Asia. Open daily from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm, it features catacombs, stained glass windows, and a 175m height, making it the second tallest church in Asia.

context: Chamundi Hills And Chamundeshwari Temple Chamundi hills are located 13 km from Mysore, and there lies a beautifully sculptured Chamundeshwari temple atop the hills. To reach the temple, a flight of 1000 steps needs to be taken. The architecture of the temple is unique, with a 7-tier gopuram and 7 golden Kalash at the top. Handcrafted with excellence, the temple is dedicated to Goddess Durga and depicts her with 8 hands, also known as Ashta Bhujas. A tour of the hills and the temple is perfect for a day of sightseeing in Mysore. This is one of the most famous places in Mysore for visiting with family. It is one of the most tourist places in the Mysore district. How To Reach: Just 13 km away from the major slopes. Famous For: Worship the Goddess Chamundi. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 2 hours.
summary: Chamundi Hills and Chamundeshwari Temple, located 13 km from Mysore, feature a unique temple dedicated to Goddess Durga with a 7-tier gopuram and 7 golden Kalash. The temple requires climbing 1000 steps and offers a perfect day of sightseeing. It is ideal for family visits and worship.

context: Sri Nandi Temple Adjacent to Chamundi hills, halfway while climbing up to the Chamundeshwari temple, lies the Nandi temple, one of the best tourist places in Mysore for religious tourists. In mythology, Nandi is depicted as a sacred bull and the friend of Lord Shiva. The 5 meters tall idol of Nandi is believed to be carved out of a single rock. There are many monkeys around the place, so one needs to be a bit careful about the belongings. Location: Chamundi Hill Rd, Chamundi Hill, Mysuru. How To Reach: Take a bus from the railway station which is about 12 km away. Famous For: Dedicated to Nandi, the mount of Lord Shiva. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Sri Nandi Temple, located on Chamundi Hill Rd, Chamundi Hill, Mysuru, features a 5-meter tall idol of Nandi carved from a single rock. Adjacent to Chamundi hills, it is ideal for religious tourists. Caution is advised due to the presence of monkeys.

context: Brindavan Gardens Built across Krishnaraja Sagar Dam, Brindavan Gardens are located 23 km from Mysore. It is a famous spot for sightseeing near Mysore and a perfect space to spend a pleasant evening. The magical fountain show is the highlight, ornated with beautiful lights and cheerful music. Boat rides and fruit orchards serve as the icing on the cake. Timings: Every day from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm. How To Reach: Situated near the KRS dam, which is 18 km from the city. You can take a bus to this place. Famous For: Sightseeing. Entry Fee: INR 15 per person for adults and INR 5 per person for children. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 3. Time Required: 2 hours.
summary: Brindavan Gardens, located 23 km from Mysore near Krishnaraja Sagar Dam, is famous for its magical fountain show with lights and music. Open daily from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm, it offers boat rides and fruit orchards. Entry fee is INR 15 for adults and INR 5 for children.

context: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens Popularly known as the Mysore Zoo, Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens was established in 1892. The zoo is among the top places to see in Mysore, especially with kids. Today, it expands over an area of 78 acres. Other than the animals found in our country, this zoo also has some exotic animals acquired from foreign zoos. If you are here for a long weekend, then the zoo is definitely one of the places to visit in Mysore in 3 days. Also, if you are visiting with kids, then this is one place that should be on your itinerary. Location: Zoo Main Road, Indira Nagar, Ittige Gudu, Mysuru. How To Reach: Situated near the Mysore Palace, one can reach here by taxi. Famous For: Exotic animals. Timings: 8:30 am to 5:30 pm (Tuesday closed). Entry fee: INR 60. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 3 to 4 hours.
summary: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, known as Mysore Zoo, is located on Zoo Main Road, Indira Nagar, Ittige Gudu, Mysuru. Established in 1892 and expanding over 78 acres, it features both native and exotic animals. Open from 8:30 am to 5:30 pm (closed on Tuesdays), entry fee is INR 60.

context: Planet X If you are wondering about places to visit in Mysore at night, then head to Planet X. This is a famous tourist attraction in Mysore located at the foothills of Chamundi. It is an entertainment center visited by one and all. This amusement park is one of the top places to visit in Mysore in 2 days. One can enjoy snooker, billiards, and many more games here. Timings: 4 pm to 11 pm. Opens at 12 pm on Sundays. How To Reach: Situated near the Mysore Palace, one can reach this through a cab easily. Famous For: Billiards and other activities. Entry fee: Free. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Planet X, located at the foothills of Chamundi near Mysore Palace, is an entertainment center featuring snooker, billiards, and more. Open from 4 pm to 11 pm (opens at 12 pm on Sundays), it is a top attraction for night visits. Entry is free.

context: GRS Fantasy Park GRS Fantasy Park is an amusement and water park in Mysore. It is a great place to visit with family, especially kids. The fantasy park has a lot of rides for one to enjoy. There are family rides, rides for kids, and thrilling rides. The place is a complete package of fun and entertainment. If you are visiting Mysore in the summer, then this is one place that you should not miss. Add it to your itineraries now. Location: Off KRS Rd, Metagalli, Mysuru. How To Reach: Hardly 40 minutes from the Mysore Palace; can be reached by taxi. Famous For: Thrilling rides and adventurous activities. Timings: 10 am to 6 pm. Entry fee: INR 700. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 3 to 4 hours.
summary: GRS Fantasy Park, located off KRS Rd, Metagalli, Mysuru, is an amusement and water park with various rides for families and kids. Open from 10 am to 6 pm, it offers a complete package of fun. Entry fee is INR 700.

context: KRS Dam Your Mysore sightseeing isn't complete without paying a visit to KRS Dam. Built over the river Kaveri, it is another interesting place to visit in Mysore. It takes around 30 minutes by car from the city to reach the dam, and so it can easily be explored if you are looking for places to visit in Mysore in 1 day. The garden at the dam is lighted every evening, and one can relax or stroll here. The musical fountain adds to the aesthetics of the place. For a trip from Mysore, you can consider this. Timings: 10 am to 8 pm. How To Reach: 30 minutes from the city, so can be reached through a cab. Famous For: Sightseeing. Entry fee: INR 15. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: KRS Dam, built over the river Kaveri, is located 30 minutes by car from Mysore. It features a garden lighted every evening and a musical fountain. Open from 10 am to 8 pm, it is ideal for sightseeing. Entry fee is INR 15.

context: Shuka Vana If you want to make your Mysore sightseeing trip memorable, you must visit Shuka Vana. The resplendent Shuka Vana in Mysore is home to over 2000 birds, making it one of the best places to visit in Mysore for birdwatchers and nature lovers. The forest reserve has about 450 varied species of avifauna. The gorgeous high aviary that covers an area of 1 acre presently has the record for the most number of bird species in an aviary in the Guinness Book of World Records. The park is also called Parrot Park and is a prestigious part of the Avadhoota Datta Peetham of Sri Ganapathi Sachidananda Ashram. Other than being a great spot for birdwatching, it also serves as a rehabilitation center for injured, orphaned, abused, and abandoned birds. Location: Avadhoota Datta Peetham, SGS Ashrama, Ooty Road, Datta Nagar, Mysuru. How To Reach: Drive from Mysore city. Famous For: Birdwatching, sightseeing. Timings: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM. Entry fee: Nil. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Shuka Vana, located at Avadhoota Datta Peetham, SGS Ashrama, Ooty Road, Datta Nagar, Mysuru, is home to over 2000 birds and 450 species. Known as Parrot Park, it is ideal for birdwatching and serves as a rehabilitation center. Open from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM, entry is free.

context: Trinesvaraswamy Temple This ancient temple in Mysore is situated right outside the Mysore Fort but is easily missed in the grandeur of the fort. The main deity worshipped here is Trinesvara, that is Shiva. Though the gopura of this sanctum was destroyed in the late 18th century, the magnificence and splendor of this temple constructed in the Dravidian style of architecture are still as wonderful as it was ages ago. It's one of the most beautiful places to visit in Mysore city for pilgrims and travelers. Timings: Sunrise to sunset. Entry fee: Nil. How To Reach: Long drive from Mysore city; can reach here by car easily. Famous For: Worship the statue of Shiva. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Trinesvaraswamy Temple, located outside Mysore Fort, is dedicated to Shiva and features Dravidian architecture. Open from sunrise to sunset, it is ideal for pilgrims and travelers. Entry is free.

context: Chunchanakatte Falls It might surprise you to know that Mysore also has a very few number of waterfalls that, though not very popular, are a true delight to the eyes and soul. The Chunchanakatte Falls, located over the River Kaveri in the Chunchanakatte village of Mysore, is one of them. Totally pristine and peaceful, this river falls off from a height of a whopping 20 meters, divided as two separate waterfalls before continuing as one single river at the base. Timings: Open all days of the week. Entry fee: Nil. How To Reach: 14 km drive from the main city; can reach by taxi. Famous For: Exotic waterfalls and bewitching views. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Chunchanakatte Falls, located over the River Kaveri in Chunchanakatte village, Mysore, is a pristine waterfall falling from 20 meters. Open all days, it offers exotic and peaceful views. Entry is free.

context: Bonsai Garden Still looking for the best places to see in Mysore? The Bonsai Gardens in Mysore are one of its most unique attractions that house more than 100 varieties of Bonsai trees that are laid out across this enormous estate. Serving as a part of the Avadoota Datta Peetham of the Sri Ganapathi Sachidananda Ashrama, this vast garden was initially a pet project of the keen Swamiji. The garden now has 450 miniature trees spread out over an area of 4 acres in this land that is filled with these unique dwarf trees. The splendor of the garden is emphasized by the small brook that flows through this garden along with the statues of Buddha and sacred monkeys placed around the area that add a charm to the representation of the zen culture showcased here. The garden also has a lush green deer park that caters to wildlife seekers and nature lovers who visit. Don't miss the Bonsai Conventions held here in the month of December. Timings: 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM. Entry fee: INR 20. How To Reach: Can reach through taxi as the place is 10 km away from the main city. Famous For: Diverse varieties of Bonsai trees and enormous plant species. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Bonsai Garden, located 10 km from Mysore city, features over 100 varieties of Bonsai trees spread across 4 acres. Part of Avadoota Datta Peetham, it includes statues and a deer park. Open from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM, entry fee is INR 20.

context: Folklore Museum The Folklore Museum of Mysore is among the most famous Mysore tourist spots owing to the sea of information it provides on the rich culture and heritage of Mysore. It's a part of the Mysore University and houses the most elaborate collections of traditional folk art, rare products and articles from Mysore history, and various other artifacts that provide an insight into the customs, traditions, art, and past of this city. A hit amongst all history geeks and culture vultures, it is one of the best museums in Karnataka and a great place to visit to witness some of the most sprawling depictions of Mysore's folk art. This is one of the best tourist attractions in Mysore. Timings: 10:30 AM - 5:30 PM. Entry fee: INR 15 adults, INR 5 kids. How To Reach: Drive from the Mysore Palace. Famous For: Various artifacts, traditional stuff, and authentic items. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Folklore Museum, part of Mysore University, provides extensive information on Mysore's culture and heritage. Located a drive away from Mysore Palace, it is open from 10:30 AM to 5:30 PM. Entry fee is INR 15 for adults and INR 5 for kids.

context: Devaraja Market One of the biggest markets in the city of Mysore, Devaraja Market is one of the best places for shopping in Mysore. It has been selling needful items for a long time. It is spread across 3 acres and offers almost 300 shops. From puja materials to flowers and vegetables, it has a lot in store. If you are a photographer, this place is heaven for you as it offers many photogenic spots to capture. Location: Devaraja Mohalla, Mandi Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka. How To Reach: It's right in the middle of the city; can reach here by taxi. Famous For: Shop Mysore specialties. Timings: 6:30 am to 9:30 pm. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings 4. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Devaraja Market, located in Devaraja Mohalla, Mandi Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka, is one of the biggest markets in Mysore, offering almost 300 shops. Open from 6:30 am to 9:30 pm, it is ideal for shopping Mysore specialties and photography.

context: Shree Shvetha Varaha Swamy Temple One of the most famous temples in Mysore must explore Mysore tourist places close to the hearts of the locals, Varahaswamy temple will leave you enchanted. On its very doors, you will find beautiful carvings intriguing enough to leave you wonderstruck, and the whole complex of the temple will give you a joyful experience. Inside the temple, you can seek blessings and embrace the peaceful ambiance. Location: Near South Gate, Agrahara, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570004, India. How To Reach: By taxi/cab. A 20-minute drive from the city. Famous For: Beautiful sculptures and intriguing carvings. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Shree Shvetha Varaha Swamy Temple, located near South Gate, Agrahara, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka, features beautiful carvings and a peaceful ambiance. It is ideal for seeking blessings and embracing tranquility. A 20-minute drive from the city.

context: Jaganmohan Palace Art Gallery Auditorium Mysore is home to a number of palaces that hold a significant place in its history and stand as great tourist places. One of them is Jaganmohan Palace, which is very grand and royal. It is home to the Jaganmohan art gallery and auditorium, where you will find artifacts that will tell you about its history and glory. More than 2000 paintings are available in the gallery, and functions are also held there. Location: Deshika Rd, opp City Bus Stand, Devaraja Mohalla, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570024, India. How To Reach: Near the city bus stand; can reach the place by bus. Famous For: Art gallery. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Jaganmohan Palace Art Gallery Auditorium, located on Deshika Rd, opposite City Bus Stand, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka, is a grand palace housing an art gallery with over 2000 paintings. It is near the city bus stand and reachable by bus.

context: Regional Museum of Natural History Mysore This is the perfect place for a good start to the day. The museum was built in order to educate people about nature and also to motivate them to take care of it. The museum is home to several exhibitions as well as a garden. It is a good place for nature lovers and those visiting Mysore with kids. In the garden, you will find local trees and much more. Location: T.N. Pura Road, Opposite Nandini Milk Dairy, Siddhartha Nagar, Mysuru, Karnataka 570011, India. How To Reach: Can reach easily via bus; close to the bus stand. Famous For: Exhibitions. Timings: 10:00 am to 6:00 pm (Monday closed). Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Regional Museum of Natural History, located on T.N. Pura Road, opposite Nandini Milk Dairy, Siddhartha Nagar, Mysuru, Karnataka, features exhibitions and a garden. Open from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm (closed on Mondays), it is ideal for nature lovers and families.

context: Kukkarahalli Lake One of the most beautiful lakes in the city, Kukkarahalli lake is spread in the form of a J and offers picturesque views. If you are looking for peace and serenity while in Mysore, then visit the lake. At the lake, you will also get the chance to witness some birds and enjoy the majestic views of Chamundi hills that served as an inspiration to a great many poets. Location: Kukkarahalli lake, Saraswathipuram, Mysore, Karnataka 570011, India. How To Reach: 10-minute drive from the city. Famous For: Sightseeing. Timings: 6 am - 6 pm. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Kukkarahalli Lake, located in Saraswathipuram, Mysore, Karnataka, is a J-shaped lake offering picturesque views and birdwatching opportunities. Open from 6 am to 6 pm, it is ideal for peace and serenity seekers. A 10-minute drive from the city.

context: Freedom Fighter's Park Dedicated to the fighters who fought for the independence of our country from the control of the British, the park offers an exceptionally joyous experience. It is a huge park and offers lush greenery. There is a statue of Mahatma Gandhi in the park. If you are visiting Mysore with your family, then you must visit Freedom Fighter's Park. Location: Chamaraja Double Road, Subbarayanakere, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 570004, India. How To Reach: 40 minutes from the city. Famous For: Relaxing, exploring the history of freedom fighters. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Freedom Fighter's Park, located on Chamaraja Double Road, Subbarayanakere, Chamrajpura, Mysuru, Karnataka, is dedicated to India's freedom fighters. It features lush greenery and a statue of Mahatma Gandhi, ideal for family visits.

context: Sanjeevini Park This is one of the best parks in the city that offers an escape from the hustle and bustle of life. It is popular amongst locals as well as tourists for its green surroundings and huge complex. There is a large statue of Laughing Buddha in the park that you won't find anywhere else. The park also has a lot of swings and joy rides to keep children entertained. Location: Near Kamakshi Hospital Rd, Kuvempunagar North, Kuvempu Nagara, Mysuru, Karnataka 570023, India. How To Reach: Can reach by taxi; 20 minutes from the nearest railway station. Famous For: Relaxing, enjoying the evening. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Sanjeevini Park, located near Kamakshi Hospital Rd, Kuvempunagar North, Kuvempu Nagara, Mysuru, Karnataka, is popular for its green surroundings and a large statue of Laughing Buddha. It also has swings and joy rides for children. A 20-minute taxi ride from the railway station.

context: Chamarajendra Academy Of Visual Arts Chamarajendra Academy of Visual Arts is one of the most spectacular places to visit in Mysore. The highlight here is the Mysore Artisan Walk, which provides an opportunity for art lovers to meet a number of artisans and learn from them about the various aspects of creating visual arts. The academy is dedicated to various forms of visual art such as applied arts, drawings, paintings, photojournalism, and the history of art. Location: Indian Text Book Press campus, Siddarthanagara, Mysuru, Karnataka. Timings: 9 AM to 5 PM (closed on Sunday). How To Reach: 30 minutes by car from the railway station. Famous For: Art sculptures, paintings. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Chamarajendra Academy Of Visual Arts, located on the Indian Text Book Press campus, Siddarthanagara, Mysuru, Karnataka, features various forms of visual art. The Mysore Artisan Walk is a highlight. Open from 9 AM to 5 PM (closed on Sundays). A 30-minute drive from the railway station.

context: Government Silk Factory One of the most famous kinds of silks in India, Mysore silk is made in the city of palaces. Mysore is known for its silk all across the world, and that definitely makes a visit to the Government silk factory important. Make a tour of the factory to learn about the making of various kinds of silk products. Also, you can shop for several silk products. Location: Bettadpura, Mysuru, Karnataka 57000. Timings: 10 AM to 6 PM. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours. How To Reach: Can reach by cab in 20 minutes from the main city. Famous For: Silk products.
summary: Government Silk Factory, located in Bettadpura, Mysuru, Karnataka, is renowned for producing Mysore silk. Visitors can tour the factory to learn about silk production and shop for silk products. Open from 10 AM to 6 PM. A 20-minute cab ride from the main city.

context: Lingambudhi Lake Lingambudhi Lake is among the most peaceful lakes in Mysore city. Rich in biodiversity, the surrounding of the lake is a great place to enjoy the calmness. Several bird species, including those from Eastern Europe and Central Asia, are the main attraction here. You can as well spot Pied Avocet, Gull, Verditer Flycatcher, and Common Teal if you get lucky. Being a favorite spot for nature lovers in the city, it is a place if you are looking for an escape from the bustle of the city. Location: Srirampura, 8 Km from Mysore, Mysore, Karnataka 570008, India. Timings: 6 AM to 6 PM. How To Reach: Can reach by taxi; it is a 20-minute drive from the city. Famous For: See various bird species here. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Lingambudhi Lake, located in Srirampura, Mysore, Karnataka, is a peaceful lake rich in biodiversity, attracting various bird species. Open from 6 AM to 6 PM, it is ideal for nature lovers seeking tranquility. A 20-minute taxi ride from the city.

context: St. Philomena's Cathedral Standing tall for almost 200 years now, St. Philomena's Cathedral is one of the holiest Mysore places to visit. This Cathedral is one of the most significant and popular Cathedrals amidst all the other places of worship covering the floors of not only Mysore but the entire state of Karnataka. Once a small church, this Cathedral was reconstructed by Maharaja Krishnaraja Wodeyar. This Cathedral is one of the beautiful tourist places to witness the architecture and designs of Mysore. St. Philomena's Cathedral also happens to be among the largest Cathedrals in the entire South of Asia. Location: Lourdes Nagar, Ashoka Road, Lashkar Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka 570001. Timings: 5 AM to 6 PM. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. How To Reach: 35 minutes from the railway station. Famous For: Amazing architecture. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: St. Philomena's Cathedral, located in Lourdes Nagar, Ashoka Road, Lashkar Mohalla, Mysuru, Karnataka, is a 200-year-old significant and popular place of worship. Reconstructed by Maharaja Krishnaraja Wodeyar, it is one of the largest Cathedrals in South Asia. Open from 5 AM to 6 PM.

context: Government Sandalwood Oil Factory One of the famous things about Mysore is their Sandalwood. And what can be better than visiting the factory of that one thing that the place is known for? The Government Sandalwood Oil Factory is one of the most exciting Mysore places to visit that exhibits various techniques of how Sandalwood products are made. One can stroll around the factory, shop for the Mysore Sandal products, witness the procedures and techniques of productions, which gives travelers a chance to learn as well as enjoy. Location: KuvempuNagar 2nd Stage, Ashokapuram, Mysuru, Karnataka 570008. Timings: 10 AM to 1 PM, 2 PM to 5 PM. Entry fee: Nil. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. How To Reach: Can reach here via cab, taxi, or bus. Famous For: Various techniques of making sandalwood products. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Government Sandalwood Oil Factory, located in KuvempuNagar 2nd Stage, Ashokapuram, Mysuru, Karnataka, is known for producing sandalwood products. Visitors can learn about production techniques and shop for products. Open from 10 AM to 1 PM and 2 PM to 5 PM. Entry is free.

context: Dr. Ambedkar's Park If getting closer to nature is your idea of a day outing, then Dr. Ambedkar's Park would surely land in your favorite Mysore visiting places. This Park is one of the best places to go, especially with the family. For those who wish to get away from the bustling city culture and embrace solitude, this park has plenty to offer. The lush greens and refreshing aura of this destination make it a perfect picnic spot for families and children to spend some quality time together. Location: 7th Cross Road, Krishnamurthy Puram, Mysuru, Karnataka 570008, India. Reviews: TripAdvisor Ratings. How To Reach: Bus; hardly 35 km away from Mysore Palace. Famous For: Refreshing picnic space. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Dr. Ambedkar's Park, located on 7th Cross Road, Krishnamurthy Puram, Mysuru, Karnataka, is a refreshing picnic spot with lush greens. Ideal for family visits and solitude seekers.

context: Javaregowda Park Another one of the rejuvenating Mysore visiting places is Javaregowda Park. This Park boasts an extensive number of fun rides and swings that appeal to the little ones and sometimes those adults who are always seeking to embrace their inner child. Be it a fitness enthusiast, a nature admirer, or a family traveling to the southern part of the country, this park has ample green spaces to meet the expectations of every traveler. The park also blankets paved paths that are perfect for a morning jog or walk. There is a gymnasium facility that has recently been offered to the public. Location: 179, 11th Main Road, Saraswathipuram, Mysuru, Karnataka 570009, India. Timings: 6 AM to 8 PM. How To Reach: Can reach here via cab/bus; 30 minutes away from the nearest railway station. Famous For: Fun rides, relaxing space. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Javaregowda Park, located at 179, 11th Main Road, Saraswathipuram, Mysuru, Karnataka, offers fun rides, swings, and green spaces. Ideal for fitness enthusiasts, nature admirers, and families. Open from 6 AM to 8 PM. A 30-minute ride from the nearest railway station.

context: Cheluvamba Mansion Built in the year 1910 by Maharaja Krishnaraja Wodeyar IV for his third daughter Princess Cheluvajammanni, Cheluvamba Mansion is spread over a massive area that is surrounded by lush green gardens in every corner. Each room in this mansion is built stupendously and each blankets some of the most intricate carvings. This Mansion is now a research institute for the Central Food Technological Research Institute. It is indeed one of the best tourist places in Mysore. How To Reach: Can reach here via cab; it is a 20-minute drive from the city. Famous For: Lush green gardens. Location: Cheluvamba Mansion, Mysuru, Karnataka 570028. Timings: 10 AM to 5 PM. Time Required: 1 to 2 hours.
summary: Cheluvamba Mansion, built in 1910 by Maharaja Krishnaraja Wodeyar IV, is located in Mysuru, Karnataka. Now a research institute, it features lush green gardens and intricate carvings. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM. A 20-minute cab ride from the city.

context: Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary is located 17 km from Mysore and is one of the most famous places to visit in Mysore. It is the largest bird sanctuary in Mysore and is home to some of the colorful species of birds like Painted Stork, Common Spoonbill, Asian Openbill Stork, and more. Apart from that, the destination also offers tourists to enjoy bird watching, nature photography, and boating. The sanctuary is a perfect place to relax on your vacation with your family and friends. Location: Ranganathittu Road, District Mandya, Srirangapatna, Karnataka 571438. Timings: 9 AM to 6 PM. Entry fee: Adults INR 50, Children INR 25. How To Reach: 17 km from Mysore; can be reached via car. Famous For: Explore the various species of birds. Time Required: 2 to 3 hours.
summary: Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary, located 17 km from Mysore, is the largest bird sanctuary in the area, home to species like Painted Stork and Common Spoonbill. Open from 9 AM to 6 PM, it offers bird watching, photography, and boating. Entry fee is INR 50 for adults and INR 25 for children.
